Graeme Milbourne Clark AC (born 16 August 1935 in Camden, New South Wales)[1] is an Australian Professor of Otolaryngology at the University of Melbourne.[2] He invented a multiple-channel cochlear implant.[3][4][5]

Early life and education [ edit ]

Clark was born in Camden, New South Wales, and was educated at The Scots College. He studied medicine at Sydney University.[6]

He then specialised in ear, nose and throat surgery at the Royal National Throat, Nose and Ear Hospital and obtained a fellowship in 1964 from the Royal College of Surgeons, London. Clark then returned to Australia and became a Fellow of the Royal Australian College of Surgeons and in 1969 completed his PhD at the University of Sydney on "Middle Ear & Neural Mechanisms in Hearing and in
